definition: (of a security guard etc) to be on duty, keeping an eye on things/to keep watch
value/(to be) worth/to happen to/to be on duty
to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining

sentences.english: Having several protective functions, the compressor set can operate without any opertors on duty.
sentences.chinese: 機組中設有多項保護功能，正常運轉後可無人值守。

sentences.english: What's out there is 2, 000 miles of unguarded frontier.
sentences.chinese: 要知道這裏以外有2000英里的邊境是無人值守的。

sentences.english: Several distributions offer a mechanism to perform automatic and unattended installs.
sentences.chinese: 一些發行版提供了執行自動化無人值守安裝的機制。

sentences.english: The invocation is basically unattended and synchronous.
sentences.chinese: 這種調用基本上是無人值守和同步的。

definition: variant of 執勤|执勤[zhi2 qin2]
to change shift/the next work shift/to relieve (a workman on the previous shift)/to take over the job
on call/always available/ready at all times
to stand guard/to serve on sentry duty
to be on duty (of a security guard etc)
to patrol/to make a tour/to inspect/to scan with one's eyes
